department.dept_long_name: Department of Visual and Environmental Studies

course.title: The Frankfurt School on Mass Media and Mass Culture
course.meeting_text: Tu. 1-3 and a weekly film screening F. 1-4
course.description: This seminar considers the Frankfurt School's deliberations on film, radio, television, and mass culture. We will devote the majority of the course to three seminal figures: Siegfried Kracauer, Walter Benjamin, and T. W. Adorno. More generally, we will focus on the debates catalyzed by the emergence of modern mass media and an industrialized visual culture; we will also reflect on the pertinence of these debates for our own contemporary culture of media convergence.
